Reviews.Title: “Very bad neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: shaytravels
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for a week long trip to Seattle because it was affordable compared to the downtown area. The room was clean and the staff was friendly for the most part. However, hotel pickup when we got to the airport was very slow. We had to call the hotel to request someone to pick us up. The major problem with the hotel is the neighborhood. Four nights out of our stay the cops were called to the restaurant right across the street from our room and people on the street were doing "questionable activities." There are even signs in the neighborhood saying you are on camera because of drug and prostitute activity in the area. The only good things about the hotel are that they offer wifi, are cheap and close to light rail. I would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Parking is NOT FREE!”
Reviews.Author: Anacortes42
Reviews.Content: I checked in late for an early flight, booked online for $51 which included free parking and a 15% discount. When I got there they then told me that parking was not free, I had to pay $93 for this mold infested [--] hole of a room. Seriously there is mold all over the ceiling in the bathroom, holes in the walls, just nasty. But the best part was hearing all the drunks swearing and singing at 2-3 in the morning. Shadey characters hanging around this place, no doubt prostitutes with their johns. Got next to NO sleep. My teenage kids were even afraid of this place! Atleast the shuttle got us to the airport on time. I have come to the conclusion that there are no decent hotels in Sea-tac and next time I will just use a park and fly without an overnight stay at the nasty hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Just like a scene from a horror movie!”
Reviews.Author: AlchemyAlice
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel at all costs! This was the filthiest hotel I had ever seen! From the Cheetos wrapper, mystery stains and stabbing-like rips in the sheets, to towel bars ripped off the walls, rust stains in the bathtub...you name a problem and this hotel had it! Not to mention I did not even get the amenities that were listed on the reservation. When I complained to management they simply said "sorry you didn't like our hotel." Yeah, well, I don't enjoy staying in hotels that look like someone was just murdered inside and the staff didn't even bother to clean up. It was embarrassing and horrifying to even have booked this room thinking that management would take enough pride in making sure that the room was CLEAN! Not to mention large, thuggish men were strolling around the parking lot and arguing outside of my room all night. I couldn't sleep at all. TERRIBLE!

Reviews.Title: “The is the worst motel I have ever stayed at and they even charged me an extra night without my permission”
Reviews.Author: vegaswasgreat
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE. First off there are seedy people all around the hotel and people passed out in the alleys near here, very unsafe, this is for starters. Then the receptionist and the Manager gave me the complete wrong directions to getting here twice which made me go an extra hour on the freeway and I had to turn around and go all the way back. Then I get a room that stunk of smoke, was filthy and had a white stain beside the bed. It was too late to get them to put me in another room. Then when I got in the bed, the sheets hadn't been changed and there were black hairs on the sheets, seriously,, it was disgusting. Then the bed topper stunk of mens BO and had not been changed obviously in a long time. It wast the worst motel I have ever stayed at and I would avoid this place at all costs. On top of that, I was charged an extra nights stay that I did not authorize and a man screamed at me when I picked up my car and said I had booked the second night, when I did not. I am furious and have contacted a lawyer about this. This type of behavior is not to be tolerated and my cc company will not be allowing the charge, but everyone needs to watch out for these type of seedy places. DO NOT STAY HERE, you have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “What a horror show”
Reviews.Author: Freda C
Reviews.Content: My husband,two friends and myself spent two terrible nights here. The first on our way out of town was scary but tolerable. The seedy characters outside were scary and the fact that the lady from the Chinese restaurant kept moving people on was not encouraging.. We left our car there so had to return to pick it up. On arriving at the airport we phoned ,with some difficulty, for the shuttle,25 minutes later I phoned again it took three calls to receive an answer and was then curtly told the she didn't know where the shuttle was and we would have to wait .It did turn up 15 minutes later, the lady driving didn't speak to us until I asked her as we approached the motel about the weather. The desk clerk was just as rude ,no hello etc, and the room we were given was terrible , as other people have commented the chairs etc were filthy the bedspreads dirty etc we slept in our clothes and left first think in the morning,after a sleepless night listening to fights etc in the parking lot. We did complain to the Travelodge corporation who passed on our complaint to the hotel,the manager wrote to us saying he was sorry our stay was not enjoyable,BIG DEAL. Stay away from this place.

Reviews.Title: “A novela about this horrific property”
Reviews.Author: Trebor240
Reviews.Content: I travel to Seattle every week for work – but pay for my own commute. So, I stay at very inexpensive hotels near the airport. For several months I stayed at the Travelodge until it became far too much to bear. I have traveled all over the world – and spent a decade working in the hospitality industry. By far this is one of the worst hotels in existence. While many air travelers stumble upon this inexpensive option, a notable portion of the clientele is comprised of prostitutes, drug addicts and gang members. For this reason, the property has many security cameras onsite – many of which seem to point directly into guest rooms. The walls are extremely thin – if your neighbor watches television at 3 am, you’ll hear it. If a john is beating on a hooker at 3 am – you’ll also hear it. If a K-9 unit is searching for a drug suspect, you’ll hear it. Guest privacy and security is of little concern to the management. Contrary to privacy standards for many hotels and motels, the front office uses stickers to write the room number on the guest key. If you lose your key and are away from your room, any of the sketchy characters in the neighborhood would know exactly where to try using it. The locks in the room are extremely questionable – some are broken, some require pushing against the door with one’s knee or a chair in order to get it to lock. With guest room numbers easily seen from the street, anyone can phone your room without going through the front desk. On one occasion I l received a call at 11 pm on the landline in the room. It was a hooker cold calling guest rooms to offer services. I kindly declined but made sure to script the conversation on Facebook. It’s easier to laugh off when you are a single man traveling alone – but if I imagine this would be very disconcerting for families with children or women traveling alone. Cleanliness is also of little concern. The chairs and carpet are horrifically stained – probably with fluids one can easily imagine. On more than one occasion in more than one room I have woken up with bed bug bites. This led me to start traveling with Cedarcide and spraying down the room before I slept in it. The smell is often whatever is being pulled through the bathroom vent. Bathroom drainage and hot water is erratic and varies greatly between guest rooms. I always check in with the same front desk agent who is always rude, defensive and curt. The guest is always the first to initiate a conversation - contrary to the most basic hospitality standards. I have never seen her smile. Once I phoned the hotel from work to ask if I could use the microwave by the front desk for popcorn. Instead of putting me on hold she accidentally left the line active. I listened to her interaction with another guest which was almost identical to my experience. She claimed to not be able to find the reservation – a common issue apparently as I book my reservations 6 weeks in advance and she almost always has difficulty finding it. Do not stay in this hotel. Pay the extra $5 or $10 a night to stay closer to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you so much”
Reviews.Author: coolCarol
Reviews.Content: I actaully didn't stay at this hotel -yet - but I was booked to stay there on my own in August before I flew out of Seattle. I had booked it through Priceline and when I told him I was travelling alone he said I would be fine. Imagine my horror yesterday when I thought I should read some reviews. I wish I had done that before hand. Pricline tell me that their agents, and hotel reaserarchers found it to be a good quality, clean and well rated hotel. I disagreed with them and asked for a cancellation or a refund to re book, they refused. They question where I got my information from and, according to Priceline, you are all wrong and they are right. Thank you all for writing your reviews. You made my desicion an easy one. Because I am traveling alone my husband was very reluctant to have me stay there so I booked another hotel through expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Waht a mess....terrible customer care”
Reviews.Author: TWINSPORTS
Reviews.Content: No cleaning nor fresh towels nor linens even though the housekeeping master log showed that this was accomplished.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare Stay”
Reviews.Author: adapj
Reviews.Content: The room was dirty and with bad odor. It's smell like dirty socks. Very noisy. No good insulation between rooms. You can hear people walking in the room on top of yours and moving things. Apparently everyone can stay there. We stayed 3 nights and even can't sleep due to a group of nasty people staying in two rooms close to us. They came late at night (4:00am) and you heard them walking, moving things, shouting, knocking the doors and laughing until 6:00am. The owner tried to took them out and had to call the police that basically never came. Don't stay in this hotel!!!! It's a NIGHTMARE.....

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel - avoid the hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: squidamari
Reviews.Content: The rooms were shabby: mildewed and peeling drywall, stained carpets, torn vinyl flooring, the bath drain can't keep up with the shower flow. Internet service cuts out frequently, if you can log on at all. No in-room coffee maker as stated on their website. Breakfast was less than mediocre: cheap white bread for toast, gas-station style boxed mini danishes, and a cheap version of frosted flakes. No waffles as shown on the hotel website photos. Hotel service was amazingly bad. This wasn't customer service, this was combat. I hung a "do not disturb" sign on the door since I didn't think I could trust the cleaning staff alone with my luggage. I asked the front desk clerk for a towel and he snapped back, "where are the towels in your room, why do you need more?". Begrudgingly, he said that he would have the towels delivered to my room. After half an hour I asked again if the towels were on the way and he said that the housekeeper had to leave to pick up guests from the airport. I checked back later and found a new front desk clerk that wasn't told that I'd asked for towels. She basically told me there is nothing she can do about it because the last clerk screwed up and that I'd have to wait for a housekeeper to get around to it. Finally, an hour and a half after my initial request, a housekeeper knock on my room door ang hands me a single washcloth and (unsolicited) tells me that if I've been having problems with the staff I need to talk with the morning front desk manager. I walk by the office in the morning to hear the manager literally yelling into a phone as a family with kids waits in the lobby. The staff jumps at every opportunity to put guests on the defensive. Maybe this is a cost saving measure for them as guests are quickly conditioned to not ask for services. If you decide to disregard hotel reviews and stay here bring your own sleeping bag and do not disturb the staff. I was surprised that a large chain like Travelodge would allow such poor service but this hotel obviously doesn't cater to repeat customers (with the possible exception of the prostitutes upstairs). For the cost of a couple of nights you could buy a decent tent and camp out under a bridge. It'd be safer, cleaner, and quieter.

Reviews.Title: “The worst motel experience”
Reviews.Author: Wonderland987
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are taking a cruise at the time of this review. We flew in from Sacramento to go on a cruise to Alaska. We had found the motel on the internet and figured that it looks ok from the photos that we saw and the price was good. It took us over 45 minutes to get from to the motel waiting for the shuttle. The shuttle driver and woman in the office were rude. We were given a room upstairs on the backside of the property. We had noticed the sign mentioned in above reviews about the safe. We dragged our four suitcases up the stairs after walking clear around the building from wrong directions from staff. We got to the room after passing several rooms with people just hanging out with the doors open. That made us feel uneasy. the security metal pin that the bar latches to keep people from opening the door was broken and missing. We noticed dirty walls and stains on the bed, and bad smell. We realized that this was not a situation that we wanted to put ourselves in. We did a good search on our phone and found a list of other places to stay. We called and eventually found a place that had vacancy's. We notified the office that we were canceling our reservation and stay. We also canceled the reservation for our return trip from our cruise. Not sure if we will get the money back. We had the shuttle driver take us back to the airport. From there, we waited another twenty minutes for the F airfield Inn Shuttle driver to pick us up and took us to the hotel. It cost double the money, but was well worth it. Much cleaner neighborhood, and property. The shuttle driver was very nice, and the Desk and security staff. Yes they have security staff. The room was very clean, and flat screen TV, refrigerator and microwave. You get what you pay for. After talking to the night manager about our experience, he had stated that several hotels and motels are not putting out the money to keep the properties up in the area. I have also written the corporation about the Travel Lodge that we stayed at. We are loyal consumers. We will be back at the Fairfield Inn 19631 International Blvd., Seattle, WA (206) 824-9909. If you want to feel safe and comfortable, then pay a little more and stay at a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, unhelpful, avoid!”
Reviews.Author: DaveandHollie
Reviews.Content: My family and I used this hotel as a cheap stop over after traveling to Seattle. We were picked up by the hotels shuttle (which is the hotels only redeeming feature - but all local hotels provide them) and taken to the travel lodge. When we arrived we had 2 rooms booked, one for my wife and I and one for my parents and younger brother. The latter room was booked as a room for 3 persons, so should have a minimum of 2 beds. When checking in, the unhelpful travel lodge personnel told us that we had 2 rooms with one bed and explained that my parents and younger brother would have to share the same bed! As my younger brother is 18, we didn't feel it was appropriate! I argued with the staff, who then told us there were no rooms available to change to as they were fully booked. The staff member then tried to charge us extra for a roll away bed, even though we had already paid extra for the third person! The staff spoke in their own language and couldn't speak English clearly. The breakfast was very poor. We were made to feel as if we were a burden. I will never return to this joke of a hotel. We had to view this as cheap and cheerful, you get what you pay for etc...however there are many more hotels around that iIm sure would offer a better service

Reviews.Title: “DON'T EVER STAY HERE!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kandiq
Reviews.Content: Ok so I only paid about $50 for the room, I am not complaining about the room itsself because, you get what you pay for. I wanted cheap so I got cheap. I book a nonrefundable 2 night stay with my 3 girls. Check-in was fine, interent was FOREVER slow, breakfast was ok. There was cereal, muffins, luke-warm milk, juice. The T.V. did not work very well, picture was hard to see and the speakers were very messed up, you could not hear the tv very well. The issue I have with this hotel is the fact that as a women with 3 female daughters, we were put in the back part of the hotel where there isn't very good lighting and scary looking people constantly roaming that part of the hotel parking lot. You never knew who was actually suppose to be staying there in the room next to you because people were coming and goign ALL the time. On the first night we called and asked to get some extra blankets and pillows(they only give you one flat pillow per side of bed) They refused to give us the extra items we requested. I had really loud noise coming from the next 2 rooms next to us ( we stayed in room 506) all night long there were people coming and going, banging on the walls,doors etcetera. Loud music being played. I called and complained to the night clerk and she told me to deal and they couldn't do anything, if I was bothered by it the I could ask them to be quiet. Being a female with 3 girls, I was NOT about to open my door and ask a bunch of scary drunken or drug induced guys to stop making noise. About 2 or 3 in the morning I had several loud knocks on teh door and it would not stop When I appeared out the window I could only see the back of one guy, peering out the door hole you could not see anyone. I didn'tr answer the door. About an hour later, there was knocking again, this time in a leep deprived stuper I opened the door with the door jamm in place and there where 2 big guys on either side of my door. I quickly closed the door and called the front desk, the guy at the front just apologized. The following night again we called and asked for more pillows and blankets, we only recieved 2 pillows and no blankets. Again the noise was very loud people coming and going it was like DeJaVu all over agian. Me and my girls finally fell asleep around 2:30ish just to be awoken by some lady screaming at the top of her lungs 'call the police, please somebody call the police, I saw the blood, please help" i called the front desk and asked them mto please call the police, he told me to do it and then after I called the police we heard teh lady wimper and cry out, a door slam and dead silence. Needless to say my daughters were scared pout of there mind! The police arrived 9did not announce who they were, banging at my ddor) When I realized it was the police i opened the door explained what had happened, they started to go room to room but that lasted about oh maybe 5 min the most and they jumped into there cars and took off. No word as to if they got him or found here or whatever, The hotel clerk called and asked if the room was alright, Of course your Damn room is allright! nothing happened in my room he didn't ask if anyone needed help he just wanyed to make sure the room was alright since I was the one that called the police. needless to say myself and my daughters could npot get back to sleep the rest of the morning, During our stay on several occasions we had peole try to get into our room, by turning and pushing on the door and or using a key card, at one point we had soemone try to climb in through our window. ( he said he thought it was his room) the morning we were leaving my girls were stil getting ready and I started to load the car. there was a big scary looking guy that was standing at the room next to mine and he was (trying to get in ) it looked like. When I came out he asked me if I was Angel, I told him no and he kept asking if I was for sure and he was walking toward me, I told him he was completly mistaken ( mean whilemy hotel door is wide open with my 3 girls in there) he approached me and asked how to work the key card( this key card was a very old one) he acted like he was tryuing to look into my hotel room I yelle dto the girld to shut the door. Thankfully some cop came driving by at that moment and I was able to go back to my room. Room wise, they wanted to put us in a one bed room at first until I requested 2 beds like my reservation said, they were fine with that. room clean, tidy, bathroom small but clean. Location was the scariest place I have ever been I think me and my girls ( who had a basketball tournament that weekend) only got at most 4 hours of sleep the whole weekend. if you want sleep, and security, don't stay here: If you want a place to party< this is the spot for you

Reviews.Title: “"If there's nowhere else to stay in Seattle, sleep in your car."”
Reviews.Author: anothertraveladvisor
Reviews.Content: Title is quoted from another reviewer, and I couldn't have said it better myself. |||||||||| I was burgled by the staff of this hotel to the tune of $165 in property. |||||||||| Keys to room worked only once, or not at all; had to continuously return to office to get into our room. Got a lot of attitude about this. It's cold and rainy, don't give ME $#!+ because I can't get into my room after hauling a bunch of crap around all day and taking public transportation to save a few bucks and give you my business. Wifi entirely unreliable and intermittent, constantly disconnected and very very low speed, while there was a router with full signal that was also named "Travelodge", but it was password-protected. Thanks a lot jerks. "Breakfast" supposedly served at 6:30am, we came down at 7:15 and no one was there. We let ourselves into the room that the food was in, and fumbled around in the dark until we could turn the lights on; lemonade in the orange juice dispenser. Nothing decent to eat (i.e. food that wouldn't make me sick or that was even remotely digestible) except raisin bran, but no milk, even when we came back half an hour later. At least there was coffee. We ended up eating deeply into our food budget the whole time because this "free Deluxe Continental Breakfast" was entirely unreliable. Room smelled nostalgically like the old bowling alley in my hometown, (built many decades ago, smoked in constantly but not recently) had to plug everything in (I guess that is standard hotel practice?) no remote, TVs are effed up ([both mine and other reviewers] colors way off and blurry and crack pipe melted into the top) and someone had spilled something syrupy all over the alarm clock; had to get my fingers sticky to force the buttons into place. People who were clearly not paying guests were hanging out at strategic vantage points on the property, calling to each other with bird whistles. Real subtle guys. Birds don't sing at 11pm at night. Neighborhood is well lit, except for the hotel. Multiple other reviewers have reported STRANGERS WALKING INTO THEIR ROOMS, supposedly misdirected hotel guests who were given the "wrong keys", but in hindsight of the theft, in light of the disclaimers about property and culpability on all the doors, and because of the prevalence, I personally doubt that these are mistakes. Parking lot full of long-term airport parking, which is probably the major source of income, since I wouldn't stay here again if it were free. Saved $5 on the way back to the airport 'cause owner in van was waiting for us first thing in the morning on our last day; didn't get to have breakfast because of that, but whatever. I regularly adjusted the curtains for privacy, (I sleep naked, sue me) only to have them readjusted by room service. (Convenient for 'enterprising' folks to case the rooms for valuables, I am guessing) I put my new camera ($135, plus $30 in memory, not to mention about 2 days of my life competitive shopping to get a serious bang for my buck) underneath the bed, left it there, and when I called the front desk to ask them to help me retrieve it, of course, SURPRISE, it wasn't there. How, I ask you, is it possible to get away with STEALING from YOUR CUSTOMERS??? Thanks a lot, thieves. Way to run a business. I guess it's just a perk of the job eh? Gotta make a little extra where you can. Can't imagine that someone might need a camera to make money, surely they're just privileged snobs, so it's cool to steal their $#!+) WORST HOTEL EXPERIENCE I'VE EVER HAD. They clearly couldn't care less about their guests, and they'd rather use the property for selling parking spaces at cut rates to air travelers, so they don't have to actually bother, oh I don't know, maybe running a ****ing hotel? The only possible explanation for having such blatant disregard for the basics of this business is because it is clearly a front for their REAL business, whatever that may be. Your guess is as good as mine. At least there was plenty of hot water...?

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: shegoesbychris
Reviews.Content: Good value for short stay. Non-smoking room still smells of smoke. Cigarette burns in comforter. Old and unsafe crib. Not safe for women traveling alone to be outside the hotel at night.

Reviews.Title: “bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: Bilbo48
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room 506. Checked in about 8pm. Bedbugs all over the place. Met 2 women at breakfast who had the same problem. Very noisy on Friday Night

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as some say”
Reviews.Author: jmorgania
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Travelodge Sea-Tac North before heading off for a one week cruise to Alaska. We were looking for a hotel to sleep in for a night. We did not need any fancy bells or whistle's. We found these reviews after booking a non refundable room and became concerned. However it is not as scary as some have made it out to be. We arrived at the airport and called for the free shuttle. Employee on the phone was nice and helpfull. Shuttle was slow and took almost 30 minutes to arrive, but we were not in a hurry and waited patiently. Drive to hotel took about 5-10 minutes. Check in was easy and staff was courteous. Upon entry into the room we found it clean. No foul odors. No crime scene tape. Bed was made, no hairs or stains on sheets. Bathroom tub was large but did show significant wear to the tub basin. Since I planned on taking a shower only it was not a concern. Shower curtain was clean. No hair or soap scum in tub. Toilette clean. Newer heat/AC unit that worked perfectly. Door latched securely. Some street noise due to proximity of major road though nothing significant. Neighborhood was a mix of some run down buildings, but many newer, clean and landscaped buildings also. 5 minute walk to the light rail that will take you to downtown for $2.50 person. We never felt unsafe while in the hotel or walking around. Note: They automatically charge you for use of the room safe as stated on a sign in their lobby. When I checked out I told them I did not use it and requested the fee be refunded and it was promptly refunded with no hassle. Free wireless internet worked perfectly and was easy to connect to. Overal it is a good place for someone looking for a bed to sleep in. However if your looking for the Hilton then waste your money and stay at the Hilton. Don't walk in with expectations of luxury, this is a Travelodge after all, then this hotel will suit you fine.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: paperprintss
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply disgusting and scary! I was initially put off by the overwhelming smell of pinesol, but then realized that was the best thing about it. No plug to take a bath, hair all over the walls ad in the tub. The nieghborhood is scary, but the door had been kicked in and the lock broken and niether had been repaired. The room itself had not been vacumed and I can only guess at the last time the bedspreads had been washed. The smoke detector was danggling from the celing by one wire. We were told to pay up front but they would not give a reciept for cash payment until we left. When we complained on our way out they said "sorry" that was it. We had asked about getting some of the items dealt with and were told "I don't know".

Reviews.Title: “Terrible and there is no doubt about it”
Reviews.Author: Snakedoctor83
Reviews.Content: Please don't make the same mistake. Me and my wife stayed here for only one night. The customer service was terrible, after a late flight the customer service person was rude and pushy. He behaved as if he was doing us a favor. The rooms cleanness was average. The next day we had there so called breakfast. They offered ceral, danish pastries and biscuits. The milk was luke-warm, and the orange juice came out of the machine as pure concentrate....I think....I didn't drink it just to be safe. We checked out that very day and went to the Clarion...much better stay.

Reviews.Title: “basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: i5405
Reviews.Content: This is a basic hotel so don't expect too much. When we first walked in the room there was a musty smell. The smell went away after we turned on the air conditioner. The cons are the room is small, there was a $3 charge for the in room safe, 4/5 lights did not work....only the bathroom light and desk light worked, the continental breakfast was very basic of cereal, bread and packaged muffins, the bed was newer but very cheap. This motel is in the poorer area of the city and yes there can be "poorer people" in the area but not always. The pros was that it was clean, wireless internet worked and we were at the end of the hotel, bus #174 is a bus that runs from the airport to downtown and the new light rail station is a 3 minute walk, there is a microwave and fridge. Would I stay here again? Well I paid $55 with a coupon so you have to compare what you are paying and what you get. I checked the prices of motel 6 and americas best value based on one of the reviews and their regular rate is $55 to 59 so I should have tried them instead.

Reviews.Title: “DISCUSTING!”
Reviews.Author: yukonsky
Reviews.Content: Do NOT expect to receive proper service, decent rooms, or a good nights sleep. This was a total nightmare of a place. It should be condemned, how the Travelodge even affliates it's name to this dump is beyond me. Stains and burns on old ruined beds, hair clogged in the sinks, and a smell that was not nice. The only reason we did not move, was that our plane got in a 3am in the morning and we were totally exhausted. No excuses, we should have demanded our money back and moved elsewhere. Never, ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Do not expect much”
Reviews.Author: iammahler
Reviews.Content: We were just passing by Seattle, so we only needed a place to stay for a few hours. We checked in at almost 10pm and left early the next day. Our room was generally clean although the bed sheet had some stain. The room has no blow dryer, so bring your own if it is a MUST. It is close to the airport but won't hear the planes from the room. Fast food restaurants are across the street. Continental breakfast is included in the price. Not a bad idea for a quick bit of muffin, OJ or coffee before heading out. It is an affordable place if you only look for a place to sleep for a night but don't expect more than that.

Reviews.Title: “If you stay here you haven't read the reviews”
Reviews.Author: AnthonyMark
Reviews.Content: This Travelodge is a pretty amazing place from the sounds of the last 10 reviews on this website. It makes you wonder how it could ever have been ranked #119 of 128 hotels in the area. It seems to me that only Hades could have been panned worse. Actually, the place seemed to me fairly typical of cheap hotels in airport zones in the U.S. I hadn't planned ahead of time to stay in the area, but airtravel difficulties forced me into an unplanned stay in Seattle past 1 a.m. in the morning, and I picked up a copy of the coupon book in the airport to find a cheap place, not looking for Shangri La. I'd tried another cheap place about a month ago in the Seatac area for the same reason, and stayed at America's Best Value Inn on the same highway, just south of the airport rather than north. They had a coupon for a $40 night and the Travelodge had one for $55. I expected it would be somewhat better, but for all intents and purposes the two places are about the same. If you're trying to go cheap, go to the Best Value or the Motel 6, both of which offer rooms for $39.95 a night. I was quoted $59.95 on the phone when I called for availability at Travelodge, but told the man I had a coupon for $54.95 and he said OK. I was never asked to show the coupon. The shuttle came for me without much of a delay, which was fine. The driver was the same as the night deskman. He had to close the office to pick me up. Same situation as the Best Value Inn. Both motels have terrible breakfasts. This place offered wheaties, cheerios, a bagel, pre-packaged cheap muffins like you'd find in a gas station, and a couple of juices. One reviewer complained only dry powder was available for the coffee. I'd suggest using the milk from the carton. It's at the very low end of "continental breakfasts", but what do you expect for bottom-feeding rates? I'd say skip it and walk to the pancake house about a half a block away. The airport highway both north and south of the airport isn't exactly a nice neighborhood, no matter how you cut it, and that goes for all sorts of hotels/motels near Seatac. Prostitutes, druggies, and people looking for the same ply the roadway. I found the room to be satisfactory so far as cleanliness went--what furniture there was was cheap motel drab. A round table was provided with two padded chairs. The TV was on top of a dresser. The TV gets cable, but the HBO which is listed on the card is not available. Nevertheless, you could get decent reception, which beats the TV at the alternative Best Value Inn. The bathtub is typical for a cheap place--no way to stop up the water so as to make it unuseable. If you use cheap places in general and like baths it's a good idea to carry your own rubber stopper. I improvised one and had a bath anyway. I didn't experience any horror with the management as others have done, but that may be because I expected nothing and didn't ask. I did have a coffee maker in the room and it worked. There were two bags of caffeinated coffee and none of decaf, which was fine with me. That decaf wasn't available is probably just indicative of sloppy maid service, which you can surely expect at this place. Parking here seems to have been a problem for some. That's probably because the hotel offers travelers flying out of Seatac parking for $6.99 per day whether you stay in the motel or not, which is a very good price for the area. That's why parking is difficult--the places are being taken by people not staying in the motel. No papers are offered. The "business center" is a computer with internet access in the office waiting area. For a cheap place to stay in an emergency, this place is all right if you don't expect much. However, the $15 more for this over the Best Value Inn translates into no appreciable difference whatsoever. TV is better here if you're a watcher. I'm not, so didn't care. The Best Value Inn has a 24-hour I-Hop half a block away. There's nowhere near this place late at night except a drive-through MacDonald's a block away. I thought Travelodge was a chain--now I understand it's an independent franchise operation. These folks don't care. Don't expect an average Travelodge. The company should disassociate themselves from this operation--it makes you suspect all of them, although I never expected much of the chain in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “Surly staff”
Reviews.Author: fishdoc07
Reviews.Content: Staff was very unfriendly and unhelpful. The airport shuttle was especially unreliable. Upon check-in we were told that we had to "reserve" a shuttle, although it only left every half hour. Upon arriving at the front desk the next morning for our 7am shuttle, we discovered that despite our "reservation," the shuttle had already filled up with other guests and left at 6:55, so we would have to wait for the next shuttle at 7:30. As other reviewers have mentioned, the wireless internet doesn't really work unless you are in a room near the office. Unlike other reviewers, we found our rooms to be about average quality and cleanliness for a Travelodge.

Reviews.Title: “A nightmare of a place”
Reviews.Author: Sniffp
Reviews.Content: There were 2 reasons why I picked this hotel. 1 was that it included breakfast and 2 that there was a free shuttle to the airport. On arriving to the hotel late afternoon (as we were flying home the next morning) and paying for the room, I noticed that I was charged almost $3 extra and when I questioned the fee I was told that it was for the safe. I said I didn't want to use the safe and I was told that if I didn't use it it would be refunded in the morning. I didn't use it and the $3 was not refunded. I was asked what time did I need the shuttle to take us to the airport and was told it ran every half hour 24/7. I said 7am would be great only to be told that there is no 7 am shuttle and it would have to be 6.30 or 7.30. I chose 6.30. Why then tell me that it ran half hourly 24/7? Then was told that we couldn't have breakfast or given antything to eat as it didn't start until 6.30am. If I had known this I would have stayed somewhere else, but I was assured on the phone 3 weeks before that it was fine and they would supply us with breakfast. There wasn't a coffee maker, coffee, sugar etc in our room so I went to reception and asked to please give me one as I wanted to relax with a cup of coffee as we'd had a very long and busy day. The receptionist didn't believe me and looked at me as if I had taken it but said she would send me one. Made several more trips to the reception desk as my phone calls were not answered and each time was told it was on it's way. After more than 3 hours and still no coffee machine when 2 males came to inspect how come there wasn't one. Another hour passed before we finally got one but were given dirty looks. About 10pm discovered that there were only 2 very thin pillows on the bed, so back to the reception to ask if we could have an extra 2. More dirty looks from the receptionist and again had to wait quite some time to get them. The next morning about 6.10am, I went to the reception to use the computer to check on our flights when I overheard a man telling another, that the driver of the shuttle which was supposed to start at 5.30am had not arrived and didn't know if he was coming in at all. He offered the man to drive him to the airport so I asked if we should wait or go with him. He suggested we go with him as we could be stranded with no one to take us. So no breakfast, no shuttle, no coffee machine, rude staff, charged an extra $3 for nothing.......NEVER AGAIN!!! The room was ok, only a double bed but clean enough, the staff however were a nightmare and the area suspect. Wouldn't stay there again even if they paid me. Travelodge should ban these people from using their name.

Reviews.Title: “Took One Look, Demanded Money Back, Stayed Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: forksbear
Reviews.Content: I booked this room via Trip Rewards web site to stay for one night prior to a flight home in the morning. I've stayed in a LOT of Travelodges throughout the country and they have always been adequate so I figured this one was similar. WRONG!!! Just driving into the parking lot, I got a bad feeling about the place. Dirty on the outside, homeless people mulling about in the parking lot, a car full of partiers in the back corner of the parking lot with their music blaring, etc. I checked in and was told that the only way I would be able to get Internet access would be to stay in a room close to the office, even though all other Travelodges I have ever stayed in have wireless access no matter how far you stay from the main office. I decided to at least go check out the room, and as soon as I walked into the room I immediately backed right out of it, walked swiftly to the office, demanded they credit back the charge on my credit card, and drove down the street to Coast Gateway and checked in for the night. The room was FILTHY and to be honest looked like it was the type of place that a prostitute would use on an hourly basis on skid row. It reeked of tobacco even though it was allegedly a nonsmoking room, the curtains were in tatters, the carpet needed to be nuked, the mirrors were filthy, the toilet had someone else's "finished product" in it and REEKED, and the scary thing was that the folks who were staying in the room next door were out on the walkway by the room drinking beer as if there was no tomorrow....quite drunk and rowdy. This is NO PLACE for ANY traveler to stay in, and I suspect they house welfare recipients. Stay here at your own peril! I STRONGLY RECOMMEND THAT YOU AVOID THIS MOTEL AT ALL COSTS!!! AND, DO NOT I REPEAT DO NOT BRING YOUR CHILDREN TO THIS MOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place like the plague!”
Reviews.Author: NHjojo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights. The photos make it look MUCH nicer than it actually is. It's right near a strip club and in a dangerous part of Seattle (i.e., I would never go out alone at night, being a single woman). I only chose this hotel because 1) it was near the airport and I wasn't renting a car until a few days later, 2) it was economical (you get what you pay for, I suppose!) and 3, I had stayed at Travelodge motels in Europe and there's no comparison to this one. The room was ugly; the bed was okay, but not very comfortable. The walls were so thin that when I entered my room, I heard a man cough and thought I had the wrong room! I actually looked in the closet and the bathroom, expecting to see someone - that's how thin the walls were. The staff members were aloof; the only half-decent one was the shuttle driver! The continental breakfast was a joke. There was NO CREAM with the coffee, and this is Seattle, a coffee mecca!! Don't stay here. Spend a few dollars more -- there are much nicer hotels near the airport. Better yet, stay in Seattle downtown or in one of the Seattle neighborhoods - if you do the research, you'll find good deals (I wish I had!).

Reviews.Title: “Worst Travelodge experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: random_traveller_05
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at various Travelodge Hotels for business over the past 30 years. I have never seen a Travelodge Hotel THIS BAD ever! The booking dates turned out to be wrong, when I called to confirm my room, and had to rebook. When we arrived, the desk clerk was arrogant and rude. The hotel room only provided one bed, even though the booking was for 3 adults, and included a roll away cot, there was no cot, and the clerk didn't offer any assistance, his attitude was 'take it or leave it'. The furniture, a chair, was completely broken, the room was dirty, the shower/tub was mildewed in the corners, and the bathroom smelled of mould. This motel is an embarrassment to the Travelodge name, and the Washington State Health Department should be looking very seriously at this facility.

Reviews.Title: “The worst ever experience!”
Reviews.Author: AgentN
Reviews.Content: A few weeks ago me and my husband stayed at this motel for just a few hours to catch our flight early in the morning. What a horrible few hours they were! First, there was no elevator, so we had to drag our heavy luggage up the metal stairs leading to the second floor. Then, we could not open the door with a key card, and had to go downstairs again to exchange the key at the reception. Upon entering the room it got only worse. The room was extremely non-cozy, and its interior reminded me of some ragged retro motel they always show in crime movies. The light inside the room was harsh and super bright. The washroom sinks were merged together with the room itself, so you could not have any privacy in that sense. The whole room also smelled like smoke, even though we stayed in a supposedly non-smoking one. BUT THE WORST of all was the lights which they have right above a large window in every room!! They were so bright, that we felt like it was a day even with the heavy black curtains draping our window. There is no way even a very tired person can sleep in those conditions! Overall, I had the most unpleasant stay in Travelodge. This place is overdue to be shut down for the its unacceptable conditions. I have no idea how this place even got a permit to be in business. Never again I will even come close to this motel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrid Experience”
Reviews.Author: travelqueenVictoria
Reviews.Content: Thought since it had the Travelodge name that it would have specific standards to follow!!! This Hotel slash Horror House was equivalant to a crackhouse. Smelled Horrible, we found BED BUGS IN THE MORNING!!!!! SOOOO DISGUSTING. They were full of blood and can come back in your luggage!!! Don't do it, not worth it Traveldoge did NOTHING about it because THEY ARE INDEPENDENTLY OWNED AND OPERATED!!! Have fun getting a rebate!!! Unfriendly and poor service. Never again...even put me off Travelodge Trademark.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the second building”
Reviews.Author: johnpr
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel in the past and generally found it servicable, but tonight has been a problem. The room which had been set aside for us contained only one bed, and when we indicated that two beds would be needed the indifferent and unfriendly clerk gave us a room in the "second building," at the rear of the property. This building, which I have not stayed in before, is much older and more run-down than the main building. Our room has cigarette burns in the chairs and bedcovers; the bathroom has gaps in the tilework; the heater does not work. The occupants of the room upstairs have been pacing back and forth since we returned to the room at midnight -- it is now 02:40 -- and their heavy footsteps shake the ceiling and make the walls creak. It is impossible to sleep with this noise going on, and the front desk has refused to call upstairs and ask them to tread more lightly, so I am taking the opportunity to use the wireless internet, one of the few good features of this room, to write this review. We also had a problem getting picked up at the airport on this trip. The first time we called we were told the van would be around in 15 minutes, but when I called back after 20 minutes there was a different clerk on duty who said there was no driver available. In the end it took a total of 45 minutes -- and a third call -- to get a shuttle. I have not had these problems at this hotel in the past, and it is conveniently located for catching a bus downtown, but on this occasion it has turned into the hotel from Hell and the staff are utterly unconcerned. As there are plenty of other cheap motels in the vicinity of SeaTac airport, I will probably not risk booking a room at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: sierick
Reviews.Content: Requested a Non smoking room, they gave us a smoking room, but then said they didn't have any other rooms available. My bed had 2 cigarette burns in the mattresses! There was also Black mold in the bathroom, and the worst part was that in the morning I found a bedbug in my bed with blood in it! I later removed the top mattress and found droppings all over the boxspring! Watch out!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Tiberious007
Reviews.Content: This was a great stop over hotel for us.We took the Clipper to Seattle and caught a plane for a friends 50th Birthday in Mexico the next morning. The room was clean,in the back building,so very little street noise. We asked for a good place to eat and they told us the chinese place rite in front of us....it was great and well priced for the four of us. We went to the lounge afterwards so all in all a great time. Could not have been a better start to our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Travelodge was a Nightmare and still is 2 months later...”
Reviews.Author: FinancialPlanner
Reviews.Content: We had the hotel booked and paid for but when we showed up just after midnight, after a long flight across the country with my wife and 2 kids they said that the hotel was full. They had no room for me to stay in. I had to drive over an hour north on the I5 to get another room. Trying to get the money refunded which they charged me was another issue. Travelodge Head Office took almost 2 months to send me a cheque for the overcharge PLUS I had to fax all kinds of proof including proof that I actually had a flight into Seattle that night. I was STEAMED! In over 20 years of travel I have never had a worse hotel experience. I can tolerate noisy airconditiners, less than perfect rooms however......... Stay at a Travelodge and be subjected to that kind of treatment over a 2 month period? NEVER AGAIN, NO WHERE, NO WAY.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: Shurik
Reviews.Content: Stay away. Dirty rooms, dirty linen. Terryible smell. Also, pretty noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Shirtless homeless man in corridor”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night and used the shuttle with no problems. The room was clean except the beds boxspring had a gross stain on the side. The bed was comfortable enough but I had to put the stain out of my mind. My room was at the back of the buidling overlooking a warehouse loading dock so traffic noise was nil. I heard a few trucks loading early in the morning though. Breakfast was muffins only. Burger King, McDonalds, small grocery store and a casino nearby but not much else. Rather seedy area overall. A shirtless homeless man was sitting in the corridor as I was leaving in the morning so it seems security is non existent.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very happy to only be spending one short night here - definitely needed some work and updating. But what really made me mad was the fact that they rent out parking places to people not staying there, so we had a problem parking when we returned from dinner. The back area of the hotel is definitely scarey!

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad...”
Reviews.Author: VinceK
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in August '04 prior to flying from Seattle back to UK. Chose the Travelodge because it was reasonable ($65/room) and offered a free lift to the airport. Room was clean, comfortable and noise-free, but because it has no restaurant we had to go outside the motel to eat, not a good idea as the area looks decidedly scarey. Anyway we survived the trip to Wendy's restaurant nearby (like McDonalds only better) and caught our flight no problem. The included breakfast did not exist ("we have nobody free to go for it"). Next time I'll chose a Hotel as the area did not appear safe but no real problems with the Travelodge itself.

Reviews.Title: “Bad part of Town”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went on a trip to East Coast, upon arrival back here in Washington, I decided to stay a local motel. I changed my mind about the Travelodge. Staff was non-existant for 10 minutes, I felt as if I would either get picked up by a prostitute or offered drugs. Stay away if you can. I went and paid $20.00 more for a nice room at the Marriott.

HotelInfo.Name: Travelodge Sea-Tac Airport North
HotelInfo.Address: 14845 International Blvd, Seattle, WA 98168
